name: Mexican Free Tailed Bat
overview: Smallest of free tailed bats has reddish to a dark brown or grey color. Tail almost half their total length and stretches beyond membrane that stretches between the legs of bats giving them the name free tailed bats. Ears are forward pointing and big compared to their heads. Wings are narrow with pointing tips making quick, straight flight pattern.
behavior: Males sing to females during courtship. Females give birth to a pup in June or July. Locate a baby by individual calls. Flies highest amongst bats around 3300m.Appear active in late morning and afternoon between June and September. Has Z-shape upper molar used for grinding insects. Eat moths, beetles, flies, dragonflies, wasp, ants, and true bugs
habitat: Prefer to live in caves but, also under bridges, attics, or abandoned buildings if it has openings and dark recesses in ceilings or walls. Like warm places and are found near bodies of water since attracts insects.
size: Average 9cm (3.5in) in length with wings of 301cm. Weigh 7t-12g females tending to be heavier by 1 or 2 grams.
tags: Tadarida brasiliensis Mexican Free Tailed Bat mammal animal animals
